title: How to watch Harry and Meghan's TV documentary An African Journey
text:
Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex both give open and honest interviews in the ITV documentary (Picture: Chris Jackson/Getty Images)

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, recently returned from a whirlwind royal tour in South Africa that saw them visit charities, organisations striving for change and even have tea with renowned anti-apartheid campaigner Archbishop Desmond Tutu.

During their time abroad, ITV News at Ten anchor Tom Bradby and has team were granted exclusive access to the royal couple to not only document their tour about also interview Harry and Meghan.

While the focus of the documentary was meant to follow the royal couple’s work in South Africa, the spotlight has inevitably fallen on the revelations that Harry and Meghan made in interviews with Tom about the struggles they are enduring behind-the-scenes.

Meghan made comments about struggling as a new mum under intense public and media scrutiny, whilst also revealing that her British friends warned her not to marry Prince Harry because of the attention she would suffer at the hands of the tabloid press.

Prince Harry meanwhile alluded to a rift between himself and his brother Prince William, as well as communicating his fury at the media scrutiny of his wife and addressing the parallels between Meghan’s contestant criticism and the way his mother, Princess Diana, was treated by the press.

How to watch Harry & Meghan: An African Journey online

Although Harry & Meghan: An African Journey aired on ITV on Sunday evening, there’s still a chance to watch the documentary online for those who missed it on TV.

The 60 minute documentary is available to watch online on the ITV Hub. Viewers can stream the programme through ITV’s online platform for another 28 days before it becomes unavailable.

Only those in the UK can watch shows through the ITV hub.
